problem: If the digits represented by $A$ and $B$ (which are not both $0$) satisfy the following addition problem $$ \begin{array}{c@{}c@{\;}c@{}c@{}c@{}c} & & & & A & B_7\\ &+ & & & B & A_7\\ \cline{2-6} & & & A & A & 0_7\\ \end{array} $$what is the product of the digits represented by $A$ and $B$?
solution: From the addition problem, we know that in the units digit, it's impossible to have $B+A=0_7$, so it must be that $B+A=10_7=7$. That means we carry a 1 to the next column and get $A+B+1=AA_7$. Since $B+A=10_7$, then $A+B+1=11_7$ and $A$ represents the digit 1. That tells us that $B+1=7$, so $B$ represents the digit 6. The product of $A$ and $B$ is $\boxed{6}$.
